**Title : Vendor Performance Management Information Technology Solution and Training Solution Request for Information**
==============================================

**Reference Number :** PW-22-01007051

**Publication Date :** September 13, 2022

**Closing Date and Time :** October 14, 2022, at 14:00:00.

**Notice Type:** Request for Information

**Scope and Context :** The Government of Canada is implementing the Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) Vendor Performance Management (VPM) Framework to optimize value and deliver better goods and services on time for Canadians. PSPC is seeking innovative ideas and solutions from Industry to support the implementation of the VPM Framework.

**Background Information:** The VPM Framework aims to improve two-way communications between Canada and its suppliers, clarify performance expectations, provide standardized means to evaluate contractors, use commodity-specific scorecards with tailored Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and eventually use past performance information as criteria in future contract awards. More information about the VPM Framework can be found on the PSPC website.

**Request for Information :** PSPC is seeking feedback, innovative ideas, and solutions from Industry that can best support the implementation of the VPM Framework. Specifically, PSPC is looking for:

* An Information Technology (IT) Solution that can operationalize the VPM Policy
* A training solution for all stakeholders

**Evaluation Criteria :** PSPC will evaluate responses based on their relevance to the VPM Framework, innovative solutions, and industry capabilities.

**Response Information :** Responses should be submitted in writing and can be addressed to PSPC through the Canada Buy Service website or by email. PSPC appreciates feedback from interested parties in regarding the VPM Framework and will use the information provided to inform future procurement decisions.

**Contracting Entity:** Public Works and Government Services Canada
